intro: Sida coromandelina, commonly known as Coromandel mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated margins, and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds. Sida coromandelina is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
